page.title: 10Crops in the Area
page.content: Most farming is arable, there area a few dairy herds, Friesians and Holsteisn on the whole. Some people rear bullocks for beef and farm sheep mainly for meat with the by product of wool from the Fleece. The arable farming consists of mainly cereals and root crops. A small proportion of land cover is hay, silage and strip grazing but this land cover is cultivated and the proportion of actual meadowland is very small. The crops consist of varying acreages of following, but these are governed by various marketing brands as to hw much can actually be grown. Largely barley and wheat, sugar beet and potatoes, rape, oats, kale, mangolds, peas and beans are grown in much smaller quantities andmainly as crop rotation.
